subject: Re: [junit] Important Query - Very urgent
msgSnippet: ... Every question is urgent, so there s no benefit in putting that in the subject line. None of us will answer it any more quickly. Yes, you can perform
messageBody:
Praveen AH wrote:
> Hi Friends,
> Can we perform integration testing using Junit or not? Please let
> me know.
> if we can perform, can you please tell me some examples..

Every question is urgent, so there's no benefit in putting that in the
subject line. None of us will answer it any more quickly.

Yes, you can perform integration testing, assuming that you mean what I
think you mean by the term.

JUnit can test anything written in Java.

As for examples, that's easy:

testBlah
A a = new A();
B b = new B(a); // integrate B with A

b.doSomethingThatUsesA();

assertTrue(b.didTheRightThing());
assertTrue(a.didTheRightThing());

I hope this gives you the idea.
--
J. B. (Joe) Rainsberger
Diaspar Software Services
http://www.diasparsoftware.com
2005 Gordon Pask Award Winner for contribution to Agile practice
Author, JUnit Recipes: Practical Methods for Programmer Testing
